result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Maxwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling, therapy as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed prescriptions only as prescribed
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.  Even if Mr. Maxwell is validly licensed to drive, if he is taking prescription medications he is not to operate a motor vehicle unless the operation of a motor vehicle is consistent with the medial recommendations and warnings the prescription medication designates
--to submit to random urinalyses and other drug/alcohol screening at the discretion of the Agent; screening is to occur at least once per month during the first year of the Probation term
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for incidental contact at employment or education programs as approved by the Agent 
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or an educational program as deemed appropriate by the Agent

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes: -  Outstanding financial obligations are converted into entry of a civil judgment.

-  6 months jail consecutive to any other sentences in being.  This sentence is to be served in the WI prison system in additional to the sentence currently being served.  JOC to reflect 0 days credit in this case. 

(If the defendant does not receive the 102 days credit in the reconfinement case, the court will upon notice direct that this JOC be amended.)

3/15/18: Court orders JOC be amended to award credit for the 102 days.

**10/18/18: Court Order that the Amended JOC should read that the 102 days applies only to 14CF265 and should not apply to 14CF149, because they were consecutive sentences the 102 days should have only been credited to 14CF265**

Consecutive to: any other sentence in being

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 1:18pm 
Defendant Michael  Maxwell appears via video conferencing from Stanley Correctional, in custody. His Counsel, Attorney Karl E Huebner appears in court.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Hearing on Sentence Credit: 
--Court verifies review of Mr. Maxwell's submissions and State's Response
--Statement made by Attorney Huebner
--Statement made by Mr. Maxwell
--Response given by DA Happ

The directs that the amended judgment should read that the 102 days applies only to 14CF265 and should not apply to 14CF149, because they were consecutive sentences the 102 days should have only been credited to 14CF265.

records.addlTxt: With JI's

cases #14CT71 and #14CF149 called at 1:47pm. 
Defendant Michael  Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 in Case #14CT71 and Count #1 in Case #14CF149; factual basis stipulated included as to the dates of the prior OWI convictions; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Maxwell guilty in each case, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 2 of Case #14CT71.
On request of Mr. Maxwell, the Court adjourns sentencing to a later date.  
The Court revokes bond in both cases. 
Recess 1:57pm.
Reconvene 1:59pm.  Mr. Maxwell indicates he wishes to proceed to Sentencing Hearing now.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Mr. Maxwell makes a statement. 

On Count #1 of Case #14CT71 and on Case #14CF149 each, the Court withholds sentences and places Mr. Maxwell on Probation for three years: 
--in Case #14CT71 only:  to serve 45 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Work-Release privileges; to commence forthwith
--in Case #14CT71 only: Mr. Maxwell is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Work-Release privileges without further process
--in Case #14CT71 only: to pay fine of $600 + costs= $1694
--in Case #14CF149 only : to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in Case #14CF149 only: to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling, therapy as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed prescriptions only as prescribed
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.  Even if Mr. Maxwell is validly licensed to drive, if he is taking prescription medications he is not to operate a motor vehicle unless the operation of a motor vehicle is consistent with the medial recommendations and warnings the prescription medication designates
--to submit to random urinalyses and other drug/alcohol screening at the discretion of the Agent; screening is to occur at least once per month during the first year of the Probation term
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for incidental contact at employment or education programs as approved by the Agent 
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or an educational program as deemed appropriate by the Agent

Days credit for time already served:  0 days. 

The Court orders outright on case #14CT71:
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Jefferson County Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 24 month period

--6 demerit points assessed

Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given. 
recess 2:27pm.
Court denies defendant's request for reconsideration of bail modification or temproary furlough pc: all
from Defendant requesting the Court to revisit his request for temporary furlough or a bail modification

Amended
(Bond to cover 14CF265, 14FF149, 14CF267 & 14CT71)

Cases 14CF149, 14CF265, 14CF267 & 14CT71 called together at 1:46 pm [Clerk SH] 
Defendant Michael Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that cases are assigned to Judge Weston, since she is not available, set matter promptly due to liberties. Can adjourn hearing if Mr. Maxwell would prefer to have matter heard in front of Judge Weston.
Atty Huebner confirms that they are ready to proceed today
Arguments by Counsel

Court presents basis and grants bond modification and requires a $10,000 cash bond, to cover all cases, with all previously ordered non monetary conditions to remain the same.
Recess: 1:57 pm
Court sets for bail review in Br. 4 on defendant's 10/30/14 request
Inmate Request form from JCSD - Defendant requests modification for family emergency
Bail/Bond Review on October 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
States demand w/cover letter

Final status/scheduling conference on November 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

cases #14CF149, #14CF265, #14CF267, #14CT71 called at 9:06am. 
Defendant Michael  Maxwell appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Huebner indicates that no resolution has been reached, so trial dates are needed.  The Defense is demanding speedy trial. 
recess 9:09am. 

NEXT:  schedule all four cases for FSSC and Jury Trial (the CT case within sixty days; the felony cases within ninety days);  Case #14CF149 is to be scheduled first in time, then Case #14CT71 next, and then Case #14CF265, and the Case #14CF267 last in time
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 20, 2014 at 08:40 am.
[MK]

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF149, #14CF265, #14CF267, #14CT71 called at 9:42am.
Defendant Michael Maxwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

In cases #14CF149 and #14CF267, Mr. Maxwell waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts these waivers and binds Mr. Maxwell over to trials in each case.
--------------------------
In case #14CF265, Preliminary Hearing is held:
Deputy Donald Petig- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Huebner
Closing argument given by Attorney Huebner. 
In Case #14CF265, the Court finds probable cause that Mr. Maxwell committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment held in Cases #14CF149, #14CF265, #14CF267:
--service of Informations admitted, readings waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered in all three cases
Attorney Huebner orally Motions to Reduce the $15,000 cash bond amount that was set by the Intake Court on August 4th.  Arguments given by Attorney Huebner.
The Court denies the Motion to Reduce the cash bond amount. 
recess 10:08am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/20/14 at 8:40am.  (2) schedule Status Conference approximately three weeks after the Pretrial date
Attorney Huebner
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Case 14CT71 called at 1:17 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Michael Maxwell appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Karl Huebner. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Court reviews case file documents and indicates that the Court deems warrant to be satisfied
Court also now calls cases: 14CF265 & 14CF267 at 1:21 pm

14CF265 & 14CF267:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Court finds probable cause within complaint to support all charges

Court now also calls case 14CF149 - 1:33 pm 
Court reviews case file documents and indicates that warrant is satisfied
Bond arguments by Counsel

Court requires a $15,000 CASH bond, to cover all cases, with conditions:
-No contact with Glenn or Linda Luczak
-No presence at N9076 River Valley Rd. Ixonia
-Not drive a vehicle regardless of licensure
-Not leave State of Wisconsin

Court informs parties that It will set matters for preliminary hearing within 10 days
Court reviews conflict review worksheet; finds no conflict and endorses
Atty Huebner addresses that he had been appointed on earlier matters, given cash bond, now may qualify for SPD Services, If he does not qualify for SPD services, would request that be appointed on new matters. Court informs Atty Huebner that he will NOT appoint him as Counsel on the new cases, but will not that appeared for bond purposes only on new matters.
Recess: 1:51 pm

NEXT: ALL CF CASES (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 8/11/14 at 9:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule 14CT71 as deemed appropriate  - Send notices
Duplicate Originals received from JCSD - Defendant is in custody
Extradition forecast

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF149, #14CT71 called at 10:07am. 
Attorney Karl Huebner in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner reports that he spoke with Mr. Maxwell last evening, informing him of this hearing scheduled today at 10:00am.  
The Court orders issuance of a bench warrant in each case--body only.
recess 10:08am.

[Clerk: MK] 
cases #14CF149 & #14CT71 called at 3:40pm. 
Attorney Karl Huebner in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner reports that Mr. Maxwell has had a vehicle break-down today and he has been making efforts to get his vehicle repaired.
Attorney Huebner indicates that a change-of-plea is intended in Case #14CT71.
The Court removes the Case #14CT71 Jury Trial from it's calendar later this week. 
Based on Attorney Huebner's indication that Mr. Maxwell can appear tomorrow, the Court schedules the hearings for tomorrow morning, expressing its intent that if Mr. Maxwell does not appear, the Court will issue a warrant. 
recess 3:42pm. 


NEXT:  Status Conference on both cases at 10:00am tomorrow
Status conference on June 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.

case called at 8:24am.  (during hearing in case #14CT71)
Defendant Michael  Maxwell in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin
On request of Mr. Maxwell, the Court appoints Attorney Huenber as defense counsel in this case.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
- at the Court's discretion, Mr. Maxwell shall undergo drug testing at the Jefferson County Jail if required by the Court when Mr. Maxwell appears for any appearance in court.  The Defendant shall pay the $6 fee for any such drug testing. A positive test result may result in bond modifcation and in a charge of Bailjumping.
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess  8:34am. 

NEXT:   (1) schedule Pretrial Conference in June  (2) schedule Status Conference on 6/23/14 at 3:00pm (when Mr. Maxwell's other case is set for FSSC)
